node.name: Dell EMC - Device Dashboard by Location
Dell EMC - Quick Glance (Tabs by Device Type)
Dell EMC - Quick Glance (All in One)
Enterprise Capacity Details (TB) - Pool Based Systems

property.name: Array
property.description: Sum of all the physical disk capacity.

property.name: Array Model
property.description: Vendor-specified name for the storage model within a product line.

property.name: Array Type
property.description: Possible values for Array Type are Symmetrix, VNX, Unity/VNXe2, HDS, HP3PAR, P9000, ScaleIO, XtremIO.

property.name: Raw (TB)
property.description: Sum of all the physical disk capacity.

property.name: Pool Usable (TB)
property.description: Pool capacity that is available for data storage. This is not supported for EMC XtremIO, EMC Atmos, EMC Centera and EMC ECS.

property.name: Pool Free (TB)
property.description: Unwritten space within pools and unbound capacity within RAID groups. This is not supported for EMC XtremIO, EMC Atmos, EMC Centera and EMC ECS.

property.name: Pool Used (TB)
property.description: Written space within pools. This is not supported for EMC XtremIO, EMC Atmos, EMC Centera and EMC ECS.

property.name: % Pool Used
property.description: Percentage of pool capacity that is used.

property.name: Pool Subscribed (TB)
property.description: Pool Capacity that has been subscribed by pool devices. This is not supported for EMC Centera, EMC Atmos, EMC ECS, EMC XtremIO and EMC Isilon.

property.name: % Pool Subscribed
property.description: Percentage of pool that has been subscribed by pool devices.

property.name: Pool Oversubscribed (TB)
property.description: Pool Capacity that has been over subscribed by pool devices. This is not supported for EMC Centera, EMC Atmos, EMC ECS, EMC XtremIO and EMC Isilon.

property.name: Customer
property.description: User-defined customer name associated with the device.

property.name: Business Unit
property.description: User-defined business unit associated with the device.

property.name: Location
property.description: User-defined location associated with the device.

property.name: Array
property.description: Sum of all the physical disk capacity.

property.name: Array Model
property.description: Vendor-specified name for the storage model within a product line.

property.name: Firmware
property.description: Vendor-specified version for the storage firmware.

property.name: Array Type
property.description: Possible values for Array Type are Symmetrix, VNX, Unity/VNXe2, HDS, HP3PAR, P9000, ScaleIO, XtremIO.

property.name: Total Raw (GB)
property.description: Sum of all the physical disk capacity.

property.name: Configured Including RAID (GB)
property.description: Configured capacity that is available for data storage.

property.name: Configured Usable (GB)
property.description: Configured capacity that is available for data storage.

property.name: RAID Overhead (GB)
property.description: Array capacity used to support RAID protection overhead. This is not supported for EMC Atmos, EMC Centera and EMC ECS.

property.name: Unconfigured (GB)
property.description: Total capacity that is available for the creation of LUNs, RAID groups, storage pools or hot spares. This is not supported for EMC Atmos, EMC Centera and EMC ECS.

property.name: Hot Spare (GB)
property.description: Capacity of all hot spares on the array. This is not supported for EMC Atmos and EMC ECS.

property.name: Unusable (GB)
property.description: Array capacity in the form of small fragments that was the result of configuration and provisioning operations. This is not supported for EMC Atmos and EMC ECS.

property.name: Free (GB)
property.description: Unbound data devices and SAVE devices, unmapped and/or unmasked thick LUNs. This is not supported for EMC Centera and EMC ECS.

property.name: Used (GB)
property.description: Space reserved or allocated for certain purposes like mapped/masked LUNs and replicas for those LUNs, space created for file systems/snapshots, system resources and other metadata/overhead space.

property.name: Used For Block (GB)
property.description: Capacity that is made available to storage area network. This column is not applicable for EMC ECS, EMC Atmos and EMC Centera.

property.name: Used For File (GB)
property.description: Capacity that is made available to network attached storage. This is not supported for Dell SC & FS Series, EMC VMAX, Hitachi, HP XP P9000, HP 3PAR, IBM XIV, EMC XtremIO arrays connected to NetApp Filer. Also not applicable for EMC ECS, EMC Atmos and EMC Centera.

property.name: Used For Virtual Storage (GB)
property.description: Capacity that is made available to virtual storage. This is supported only if you have EMC VPLEX or IBM SAN Volume Controller/Storwize in your IT environment. It will be blank for Dell SC & FS Series, EMC Unity, IBM DS, EMC ScaleIO and EMC Isilon with EMC VPLEX at the backend and for Dell SC & FS Series, EMC Unity, EMC XtremIO, EMC Isilon, HP StorageWorks P9000, EMC ScaleIO, IBM DS arrays with IBM SVC at the backend as they are not supported. Also not applicable for EMC ECS, EMC Atmos and EMC Centera.

property.name: Used For HDFS (GB)
property.description: Capacity that is made available to Hadoop Filesystem storage.

property.name: Used For Object (GB)
property.description: Capacity that is made available to object storage.

property.name: Primary Used (GB)
property.description: Array capacity that has been mapped, masked, and configured for the primary storage of application data. This does not include copies. This column is not applicable for EMC Isilon, EMC Atmos and EMC Centera.

property.name: Local Replica Used (GB)
property.description: Array capacity that has been mapped, masked, and configured as local replicas. This capacity is commonly used for testing and backup. This column is not applicable for EMC Isilon, EMC Atmos, EMC Centera and EMC ECS.

property.name: Remote Replica Used (GB)
property.description: Capacity used for remote copies, commonly for disaster recovery. This column is not applicable for EMC Isilon, EMC Atmos, EMC Centera and EMC ECS.

property.name: System Used (GB)
property.description: Capacity reserved for use by the array for internal operations. This column is not applicable for EMC Isilon, EMC Atmos, EMC Centera and EMC ECS.

property.name: Pool Usable (GB)
property.description: Pool capacity that is available for data storage. This is not supported for EMC XtremIO, EMC Atmos, EMC Centera and EMC ECS.

property.name: Pool Free (GB)
property.description: Unwritten space within pools and unbound capacity within RAID groups. This is not supported for EMC XtremIO, EMC Atmos, EMC Centera and EMC ECS.

property.name: Pool Used (GB)
property.description: Written space within pools. This is not supported for EMC XtremIO, EMC Atmos, EMC Centera and EMC ECS.

property.name: % Pool Used
property.description: Percentage of pool capacity that is used.

property.name: Pool Subscribed (GB)
property.description: Pool Capacity that has been subscribed by pool devices. This is not supported for EMC Centera, EMC Atmos, EMC ECS, EMC XtremIO and EMC Isilon.

property.name: % Pool Subscribed
property.description: Percentage of pool that has been subscribed by pool devices.

property.name: Pool Oversubscribed (GB)
property.description: Pool Capacity that has been over subscribed by pool devices. This is not supported for EMC Centera, EMC Atmos, EMC ECS, EMC XtremIO and EMC Isilon.

property.name: FTS (GB)
property.description: Sum of all externally provisioned and imported disk capacities.

property.name: Customer
property.description: User-defined customer name associated with the device.

property.name: Business Unit
property.description: User-defined business unit associated with the device.

property.name: Location
property.description: User-defined location associated with the device.

property.description: Storage Capacity of the NAS System. This is not supported for EMC Isilon and EMC Data Domain.

property.name: Disks Used (GB)
property.description: Storage Capacity of production file systems and their overhead, storage capacity of SavVols and Free NAS Pool capacity. This is not supported for EMC Isilon and EMC Data Domain.

property.name: Free Capacity on Used Disks (GB)
property.description: Free partition, free meta volumes and free space on partially used disks. This is not supported for EMC Isilon and EMC Data Domain.

property.name: Unused Disks (GB)
property.description: Storage Capacity of non-partitioned NAS Disks. This is not supported for EMC Isilon and EMC Data Domain.

property.name: Usable File System (GB)
property.description: Storage capacity of production file systems on NAS Disks or NAS Pools.

property.name: Snapshot (GB)
property.description: Storage capacity of SavVols on NAS Disks or NAS Pools. This is not supported for EMC Isilon and EMC Data Domain.

property.name: NAS Pool Free (GB)
property.description: Free NAS Pool capacity that is available to create production file systems and SavVols. This is not supported for EMC Isilon and EMC Data Domain.

property.name: File System Overhead (GB)
property.description: Reserved overhead capacity to support a production file system. This is not supported for EMC Isilon and EMC Data Domain.

property.name: File System Presented (GB)
property.description: The total capacity presented to production file systems. This is not supported for EMC Isilon.

property.name: File System Used (GB)
property.description: Used capacity of production file systems.

property.name: File System Free (GB)
property.description: Free capacity of production file systems.

property.name: Primary Used (GB)
property.description: Array capacity that has been exported as NAS shares. This does not include copies or snapshots. This is not supported for EMC Isilon.

property.name: Local Replica Used (GB)
property.description: Array capacity that has been used as local replicas of NAS shares. This capacity is commonly used for testing and backup. This is not supported for EMC Isilon and EMC Data Domain.

property.name: Remote Replica Used(GB)
property.description: Capacity used for remote copies of NAS shares, commonly for disaster recovery. This is not supported for EMC Isilon and EMC Data Domain.

property.name: System Used (GB)
property.description: Storage Capacity of NAS Disks used for internal file systems. This is not supported for EMC Isilon.

property.description: Object capacity that does not have any associated replication or implicit protection.

property.description: Object capacity that has either has implicit protection or replicas that exist within the same array.

property.description: Object capacity that has replicas that exist on a different array. This will be empty for EMC ECS, if remote replicas don't exists. This is not supported for EMC Atmos and EMC Centera.

property.description: Capacity reserved for use by the array for internal operations. This is not supported for EMC Atmos and EMC ECS.

property.description: The number of objects that are currently stored on this array. This is not supported for EMC Atmos.

property.description: This shows the total disk capacity on the XtremIO Storage Array

property.description: This displays the usable physical capacity not including the RAID, Meta overhead etc. [Configured Usable = (Total Raw - RAID overhead)]

property.description: This displays the Physical Used Capacity on the XtremIO Storage Array.

property.name: % Used
property.description: Percentage of system capacity that is used.

property.name: Volume Capacity (TB)
property.description: This displays the logical capacity information of XtremIO Storage Array.

property.name: Volume Used Capacity (TB)
property.description: Logical (Lun) used capacity. Calculated by adding up all volumes and snapshot's logical space in use. [where 'isused' is true]

property.name: Potential Data Space (TB)
property.description: Potential Data Space is calculated based on Free Capacity and Efficiency of the array ( Free Capacity * Efficiency)

property.name: Dedup Ratio
property.description: This displays the real-time inline data reduction ratio

property.name: Compression (:1)
property.description: This displays the data compression ratio which is calculated in XMS by dividing unique data by physical space used

property.name: Efficiency (:1)
property.description: This displays the disk space saved by the XtremIO Storage Array, calculated as volume capacity / physical space used.

property.name: Thin Provisioning Savings (%)
property.description: This displays the used disk space compared to allocated disk space.

property.name: Cluster Name
property.description: Cluster details

property.name: Management Server
property.description: Management IP address or Hostname

property.name: Model
property.description: Model Details

property.name: Serial Number
property.description: Serial Number

property.name: Firmware
property.description: XtremIO version details

property.name: Raw Capacity
property.description: This shows the total disk capacity on the XtremIO Storage Array

property.name: Configured Usable Capacity
property.description: This displays the usable physical capacity not including the RAID, Meta overhead etc. [Configured Usable = (Total Raw - RAID overhead)]

property.name: Used Capacity
property.description: This displays the Physical Used Capacity on the XtremIO Storage Array.

property.name: Free Capacity
property.description: This shows the total free capacity on the XtremIO Storage Array. [Free Capacity = (ConfiguredUsableCapacity - UsedCapacity)]

property.name: Volume Capacity
property.description: This displays the logical capacity information of XtremIO Storage Array.

property.name: Volume Used Capacity
property.description: Logical (Lun) used capacity. Calculated by adding up all volumes and snapshot's logical space in use. [where 'isused' is true]

property.name: Presented Capacity
property.description: Capacity that is made available to clusters

property.name: Potential Data Space
property.description: Potential Data Space is calculated based on Free Capacity and Efficiency of the array ( Free Capacity * Efficiency)

property.name: Dedup Ratio
property.description: This displays the real-time inline data reduction ratio

property.name: Compression (:1)
property.description: This displays the data compression ratio which is calculated in XMS by dividing unique data by physical space used

property.name: Efficiency (:1)
property.description: This displays the disk space saved by the XtremIO Storage Array, calculated as volume capacity / physical space used.

property.name: Thin Provisioning Savings (%)
property.description: This displays the used disk space compared to allocated disk space.

property.name: Storage System Type
property.description: Possible values are Block, File, Unified, Virtual and Object.

property.name: Storage System Alias
property.description: User defined name for the Array, default is serial number.

property.name: Serial Number
property.description: Vendor-specified serial number for the storage system.

property.name: Model
property.description: Vendor-specified name for the storage model within a product line.

property.name: Vendor
property.description: Name of vendor.

property.description: The severity of the alert, (CRITICAL, MAJOR, MINOR, UNKNOWN, INFORMATIONAL, OK).

property.name: Ack?
property.description: A YES (1) value indicates that the alert has been acknowledged by a user.

property.name: Owner
property.description: The current owner of the alert.

property.name: Component Type
property.description: The component type that the alert occurred on.

property.name: Component
property.description: The component that the alert occurred on.

property.name: Name
property.description: The name of the alert.

property.name: Source
property.description: The source of the alert.

property.name: Device
property.description: The device that the alert occurred on.

property.name: Device Type
property.description: The device type that the alert occurred on.

property.name: Created At
property.description: The date and time when the alert first occurs.

property.name: Type
property.description: The type of alert, (MOMENTARY, DURABLE).

property.name: Active?
property.description: A YES (1) value indicates this alert is currently active on the system.

property.name: Category
property.description: The category of the alert.

property.name: Closed At
property.description: The date-time when the alert was closed.

property.name: Count
property.description: Shows how many times an alert has occurred.

property.name: Duration
property.description: The duration between when the alert was ACTIVE to INACTIVE.

property.name: ID
property.description: The ID of the alert occurrence as it exists in the database.

property.name: Last Changed At
property.description: The date and time when an alert was last updated.

property.name: Message
property.description: A message used to describe more information about the alert.

property.name: Problem?
property.description: A YES (1) value indicates this alert was discovered via Codebook Correlation.

property.name: Root?
property.description: A YES (1) value indicates this alert is has no known deeper underlying cause.

property.name: State
property.description: The current state of the alert, (ACTIVE or INACTIVE).

property.name: System Name
property.description: System name.

property.name: Protocol
property.description: Protocol name.

property.name: Total Throughput (IOPS)
property.description: Number of calls passed via the protocol per second. This includes reads and writes, along with other protocol-specific commands which may accompany them.

property.name: Bandwidth (MB/s)
property.description: Number of Mbytes passed via the protocol per second. This includes reads and writes.

property.name: Average Latency (ms)
property.description:
The average time per protocol operation, across all storage processors. This includes reads and writes, along with other protocol-specific commands which may accompany them.
For CIFS, this is the total time to complete all SMB1 and SMB2 operations, divided by the total number of SMB1 and SMB2 operations for the polling period. SMB2 includes the SMB3 protocol.
For NFS, this is the total time to complete all NFSv3 and NFSv4 operations, divided by the total number of NFSv3 and NFSv4 operations for the polling period. NFSv2 is not supported on Unity.
Note: This metric is only available for arrays with OE 4.0 and higher.

property.description: Number of Open Files. Open Files is only available for CIFS

property.name: Status
property.description: Current state of the object.

A measure of the amount of FAST Cache that has been written to more recently than the original LUNs. The "clean" I/O, where the copies of the block on the Storage Pool and the FAST Cache match is not counted in this percentage. This is not a measure of the amount of data in FAST Cache because FAST Cache % full would be both the clean and the dirty pages. Unisphere does not track the total amount of data in FAST Cache and it is assumed to be nearly full at all times when it is enabled.

property.description: The total sum of read/write bandwidth across all File Systems on the array. Note: Arrays with Operating Environment version prior to 4.0 will always display 0.
This report presents the overall throughput (IOPS) across all Storage Processors on the array.

• Read Throughput (IOPS): Number of read requests that is passed through the Storage Processor per second.
  • Write Throughput (IOPS): Number of write requests that is passed through the Storage Processor per second.

• Utilization (%) :100 * (Busy Ticks/s) / (Busy Ticks/s + Idle Ticks/s) Percentage of time that the Storage Processor was busy serving incoming requests. Busy Ticks/s: Number of ticks (1 tick = 100 ms) that occurred when LUN was busy. Idle Ticks/s: Number of ticks (1 tick = 100 ms) that occurred when LUN was idle.
  • Queue Length: (Average Busy Queue Length) * (% Utilization) Average number of requests that are waiting while the Storage Processor is busy, including the current request in service.
  • Average Busy Queue Length: (Sum Queue Lengths - Number Arrivals With Non Zero Queue / 2) / (Read Throughput [IO/s] + Write Throughput [IO/s]) Sum Queue Lengths: Number of requests waiting for the disk within a time interval, including the current request in service. Number Arrivals With Non Zero Queue: Number of times that a user request arrived while at least one other request was being processed.

property.description: Ratio of the sum of all TDEVs + RDP Logical Backend Storage (calculated based on the 128K track size) and the TDEVs + RDP Physical Used Storage (calculated based on the compressed pool track size) A compression ratio of 0.0:1 indicates compression is not supported, is disabled, or is enabled but has no compression in use.

property.description: The total read requests from all front-end directors per second that were misses. A miss occurs when the requested data is not in cache.

property.name: File System Free

property.name: System Name
property.description: Device name.

property.name: Serial Number
property.description: Vendor specified serial number.

property.name: Storage System Type
property.description: Indicates if object type is Unified, Block or File.

property.name: Processor Utilization (%)
property.description: The average utilization across all storage processors on the array. Note: This column will display N/A for File storage systems.

property.name: Block Throughput (IOPS)
property.description: The total sum of read/write requests across all Storage Processors on the array. Note: This column will display N/A for File storage systems.

property.name: Block Bandwidth (MB/s)
property.description: The total sum of read/write bandwidth across all Storage Processors on the array. Note: This column will display N/A for File storage systems.

property.name: Block Response Time (ms)
property.description: The average response time (latency) across all Storage Processors on the array. Note: This column will display N/A for File storage systems.

property.name: File Throughput (IOPS)
property.description: The total sum of read/write requests across all DataMovers on the array. Note: This column will display N/A for Block storage systems.

property.name: File Bandwidth (MB/s)
property.description: The total sum of read/write bandwidth across all DataMovers on the array. Note: This column will display N/A for Block storage systems.
Note: This tab applies for Unified and Block storage systems, but not for File.
The total sum of read/write requests across all Storage Processors on the array. Note: This column will display N/A for File storage systems.
The total sum of read/write bandwidth across all Storage Processors on the array. Note: This column will display N/A for File storage systems.
This report presents the overall throughput (IOPS) across all Storage Processors on the array.

• Read Throughput (IOPS): Number of read requests that is passed through the Storage Processor per second.
  • Write Throughput (IOPS): Number of write requests that is passed through the Storage Processor per second.
Note: This tab applies for Unified and Block storage systems, but not for File.
Total amount of processing cycles, as a percentage, across all cores of the Storage Processor(s).
Total amount of processing cycles, as a percentage, across all cores of the Storage Processor(s).
Ratio of dirty pages to total pages in the storage processor FAST Cache, expressed as a percentage.
Ratio of dirty pages to total pages in the storage processor FAST Cache, expressed as a percentage.
Percentage of read requests to the SP that were hits for the SP read cache. A read cache hit occurs when the SP finds a page in read cache memory, saving a disk read operation.
Percentage of read requests to the SP that were hits for the SP read cache. A read cache hit occurs when the SP finds a page in read cache memory, saving a disk read operation.
Percentage of write cache hits to the SP. A write cache hit occurs when the SP finds and modifies already-modified data in the write-cache memory, eliminating disk read and write operations
Percentage of write cache hits to the SP. A write cache hit occurs when the SP finds and modifies already-modified data in the write-cache memory, eliminating disk read and write operations
Note: This tab applies for Unified and Block storage systems, but not for File.
Displays the number of LUN read requests processed by SP A.
Displays the number of LUN read requests processed by SP B.
Displays the number of LUN write requests processed by SP A.
Displays the number of LUN write requests processed by SP B.
Displays the amount of LUN read bandwidth processed by SP A.
Displays the amount of LUN read bandwidth processed by SP B.
Displays the amount of LUN write bandwidth processed by SP A.
Displays the amount of LUN write bandwidth processed by SP B.
Displays the average LUN response time/latency as observed by SP A.
Displays the average LUN response time/latency as observed by SP B.
Note: This tab applies for Unified and File storage systems, but not for Block.
Displays the number of CIFS read requests.
Displays the number of CIFS write requests.
Displays the amount of CIFS read bandwidth.
Displays the amount of CIFS write bandwidth.
Displays the number of NFS read requests.
Displays the number of NFS write requests.

property.name: Avg Throughput Over 2 Weeks
property.description: The amount of data read/written per second.

property.name: Avg Bandwidth Over 2 Weeks
property.description: The amount of data read/written per second.

property.name: SLA Compliance
property.description: This displays the percentage of SLA latency Met

property.name: Free Capacity (ORIG)
property.description: This displays the usable physical capacity not including the RAID, Meta overhead etc. [Configured Usable = (Total Raw - RAID overhead)]

property.name: Data Reduction Ratio
property.description: This displays the data reduction ratio which is calculated in XMS by dividing logical space used by physical space used

property.name: Usable
property.description: This displays the usable physical capacity not including the RAID, Meta overhead etc. [Configured Usable = (Total Raw - RAID overhead)]

property.name: Used
property.description: This displays the Physical Used Capacity on the XtremIO Storage Array.

property.name: Free
property.description: This shows the total free capacity on the XtremIO Storage Array. [Free Capacity = (ConfiguredUsableCapacity - UsedCapacity)]

property.name: Volume Capacity
property.description: This displays the logical capacity information of XtremIO Storage Array.

property.name: Volume Used Capacity
property.description: Logical (Lun) used capacity. Calculated by adding up all volumes and snapshot's logical space in use. [where 'isused' is true]

property.name: Potential Data Space
property.description: Potential Data Space is calculated based on Free Capacity and Efficiency of the array ( Free Capacity * Efficiency)

property.name: Dedup Ratio
property.description: This displays the real-time inline data reduction ratio

property.name: Efficiency (:1)
property.description: This displays the disk space saved by the XtremIO Storage Array, calculated as volume capacity / physical space used.

property.name: Thin Provisioning Savings (%)
property.description: This displays the used disk space compared to allocated disk space.

property.name: Compression (:1)
property.description: This displays the data compression ratio which is calculated in XMS by dividing unique data by physical space used

property.name: Avg Throughput - Last 1 Day
property.description: The amount of data read/written per second.

property.name: Avg Bandwidth - Last 1 Day
property.description: The amount of data read/written per second.
